newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures plunge on Thai Baht float.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures plunge on Thai Baht float.

text.p: Singapore rubber futures plunged on Wednesday in heavy trade following Thailand's decision to float the Thai baht today in an attempt to stop the currency from spinning into a freefall, dealers said.

"The market was very sellerish today. Everything was hit. The bearish sentiment was felt in all the rubber markets. It's been one of those rare days when volume was heavy for a change," a local broker said.
"Uncertainty over the Baht float dragged prices down. The market was already in a bear phase, a little rumour was heard and next prices were falling," another broker said.
At around 0945 GMT, August RSS3 plunged 7.50 cents to 92.00 U.S. cents a kg.
September RSS1 dropped 6.50 cents to 140.00 Singapore cents (US$0.98) a kg.
August TSR20 fell 4.50 cents to 130.50 Singapore cents (US$0.91) a kg.
